Stańczyk is a famous painting by Polish artist Jan Matejko, depicting the court jester Stańczyk in a melancholic pose. The scene shows Stańczyk sitting alone in a dimly lit room, deep in thought, while a lively ball takes place in the background. This painting is notable for its historical context and the portrayal of the jester as a wise and introspective figure rather than a mere entertainer. It is currently held in the Warsaw National Museum in Poland.
